DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether an intervention consisting of the implementation of guidelines about daily systematic pain assessment following a theory based education, targeting cancer-related pain and pain treatment, lead to a significantly positive improvement in RNs knowledge of, and attitudes towards their pain management. Furthermore will the interventions targeting the RNs influence the admitted patient's perception of their cancer-related pain?
DOC.brief_title: Educational Intervention Targeting Nurses Attitudes and Knowledge About Cancer-related Pain Management
DOC.criteria: Cancer diagnosis Aged 18 years and above Cognitively intact and able to verbally communicate At admission pain intensity >1 on Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Trauma or planned and/or acute surgery.
